summary:
The Security Council:
- Recalling its previous resolutions on Libya, 
- Reaffirming its commitment to a Libyan-led political process,
- Recalling the situation in Libya continues to threaten international peace and security,

1. Extends the mandate of UNSMIL until 31 July 2022,
2. Takes note of the Independent Strategic Review, requests implementation of recommendations, and leadership by a Special Representative,
3. Requests exploring efficiency and redeployment of resources,
4. Calls on parties to refrain from actions undermining the political process or ceasefire, 
5. Emphasizes no military solution, demands compliance with arms embargo,
6. Requests the Secretary-General to report every 30 days until 31 July 2022,
7. Decides to remain seized of the matter.
